title.narrative: Promoting Agroecological Practices through Systematic Training

description.narrative: This project will build rural capacities and improve small farms so Heifer and partnering organizations can holistically promote an agroecological way of farming within the framework of constructing food sovereignty. However, the difficulties in changing from conventional production to an agroecological approach call for systematic training in agroecology. Therefore, 70 small farmers will begin work with agroecology in rural organizations and communities. The project will then benefit 300 families educationally and technologically, as well as another 6,000 when their studies are finished. Small farming will be improved by establishing a national-level Agroecology School, co-implemented with rural organizations. Two one-year cycles will yield 35 technicians each in agroecology, trained to produce and train others in rural communities and organizations. Heifer will provide trainers, instructional materials and literature for training over two years.
